note.p: Burial: On the bank of the River Chagres, between Palamatio Viejo and Palamatio Nueva, Panama

Career: Entered Navy (1812); did surveying work in America; sailed with Basil Hall (FRS 1816) to South America (1820); astronomer to Parry's third voyage and in his attempt to reach the North Pole (1827); commanded Chanticleer (1828)

Copley Medal awarded 1827; at the same time a second Copley Medal was awarded to William Prout, 'For his paper, entitled, On the ultimate Composition of simple alimentary substances, with some preliminary remarks on the analysis of organized bodies in general'.
Medals/Prizes: Copley Medal 1827 'for his magnetic and other observations made during the Arctic expedition to Port Bowen'
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1830-1831 No 7 p 82
References: G E Fogg, 'The Royal Society and the Antarctic' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 85-98
Notes: DSB incorrectly gives date of birth as Aug 1797; memorial in Woodplumpton parish church, near Preston gives death date as 8 Feb 1831 in his 34th year of age
